There was a similar number of 65 cattle at Powranna on Tuesday with less cows and a good quality number of yearlings and grown steers. The yearlings lost a little of last weekâ€™s increase with steers making 330c to 358c and heifers 298c to 352c.
Grown steers and bullocks improved 10c to make 340 to 372c while heavy export heifers sold for 298c to 348c.

There were only 20 cows with most being heavy beef types that made 290c to 304c/kg liveweight.

Market Reporter Richard Bailey
